title: Web Developer
description:
We’re Hiring Web Developers!

Come join one of the coolest companies on the planet - we’re disrupting the space industry and we’re growing fast.

Our first mission is to image the entire Earth, every day, and make this data accessible using web tools, to gain insight about our changing planet. From our San Francisco HQ we build, plan launches, and operate the largest fleet of Earth Imaging satellites in history. We are an agile and data-driven company from hardware, to software, to business development and are looking for a Web Developer to join our team!

Some recent press about us: “A Tech Start-Up Just Restored My Faith in Humanity” by Kevin Roose, NY Magazine http://nymag.com/daily/intelligencer/2014/08/tech-start-up-restored-my-faith-in-humanity.html

A Start-Up Provides a Picture of Our Shape-Shifting Planet by Quentin Hardy, NYTimes Bits http://bits.blogs.nytimes.com/2014/08/13/start-up-provides-a-picture-of-our-shape-shifting-planet/?_php=true&_type=blogs&_r=0

We have Web Developer positions open on the following teams:

Website team

Internal Tools Team

Apps Team

Satellite Manufacturing Team

Check out our website and see them all: www.planet.com

Who we are:

Planet Labs aims to exponentially increase humanity's knowledge about our planet by delivering daily pictures of every place on earth. We design, build and operate the largest constellation of earth imaging satellites - all in our San Francisco office. Our mission is to democratize how people use, analyze and gain insight from information about our planet. We control every component of hardware design and manufacturing, so our office is a truly inspiring mix of experts in a variety of domains.

What you need to be a web developer:

  • Expert level client-side coding skills and experience (HTML/CSS/JavaScript)
  • Working knowledge of backend languages (Python preferred) and frameworks (Django, Flask, Jekyll, etc)
  • Passion for technology and investigating new tools/libraries
  • Ability to create, clean, organized HTML and CSS code for great readability, reuse, performance and maintainability
  • Hands on experience applying Web standards (W3C) and best practices to Responsive Web Design
  • Great communication skills and experience working with a variety of different teams
  • Comfortable taking the lead on projects and working without lots of oversight

What it’s like:

Planet Labs is located in a great SOMA location in San Francisco. We have a great culture including catered lunches, ton of snacks, weekly lightning talks and colloquiums and all company retreats for a start. If you are feeling inspired, check out our website www.planet.com to see all of our positions.

SUMMARY A full stack web engineer at zVelo is a senior engineer who participates in planning, design, development and maintenance of our internal and external web applications and services. ABOUT OUR STACK

title: Senior Applications Developer
description:
Are you interested in being at the centre of cutting edge applications that support the delivery of the Government's online communications to Ontarians?

Working with the Enterprise Applications Branch of the Central Agency I&IT Cluster, you will have the opportunity to work with leading technologies on interesting and diverse projects with a motivated and energetic team of IT and new media professionals.

What can I expect to do in this role?

As a Senior Applications Developer, you will:

  • provide technical expertise in all phases of the system development lifecycle from design, development, testing, implementation to post implementation support
  • develop solutions using cutting edge open source web technologies to meet client's IT requirements
  • conduct complex analysis and suggest application improvements and long-term strategies to support business goals
  • conduct testing to ensure developed solutions meet client's requirements and perform as expected
  • design and deliver training and provide support to end users
  • develop production support procedures and provide production support for business critical systems
  • maintain market knowledge of the latest open source web technologies, platforms, standards and guidelines

Location: 222 Jarvis Street, Toronto, Ontario

How do I qualify?

Technical Knowledge and Skills:

  • you have knowledge and experience in the development, testing and implementation of LAMP solutions/open source web technologies (e.g. Drupal, DocumentCloud, Lucene, Solr)
  • you have programming experience (e.g. markup languages, HTML 5, CSS 3, XML, scripting, procedural and OO languages, PHP, Java, Javascript, AJAX and Frameworks, AngularJS, Express, Node.js)
  • you have knowledge in designing, developing and implementing systems solutions in different environments (e.g. cloud architecture such as Amazon), tools, deployment models and best practices
  • you have experience in coding, repairing and enhancing complex programming modules (e.g. service-oriented architecture and REST API's using Google Maps/Analytics, Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, etc.)
  • you have experience in designing, building and administering database management systems (e.g. MySQL, Oracle, PostgressSQL, MongoDB, Hadoop, Redis)
  • you have experience using code management tools (e.g. GIT)
  • you have knowledge of emerging Internet technologies, trends, international web (e.g. WCAG 2.0 AAA) standards and security (e.g. OWASP) best practices
  • you have experience in providing production support

Analytical and Evaluation Skills:

  • you can assess client's information/systems needs and complex problems and lead the development of information technology solutions which are cost effective and improve client program/service delivery

Communication Skills:

  • you have effective oral and written communications skills to prepare reports, business cases, RFP's, project reports and make presentations to clients, stakeholders and users to discuss requirements, solution options and recommendations
  • you have conflict resolution, problem-solving, negotiation and client relation development skills

Project Planning and Change Management Skills:

  • you have experience with methodologies (e.g. SDLC, Agile, SCRUM, etc.) to plan technical activities and schedules by determining technical requirements, resources and cost estimates
  • you have experience in incident and change management processes

Salary range: $1,357.77 – $1,753.98 per week

title: Front-End Engineer
description:
Justworks is a fast-growing startup founded in late 2012, located in New York’s Flatiron district.

 We are led by ex- Amazon, Etsy, and Groupon executives, and backed by Index Ventures (Dropbox, SoundCloud, Skype).

We are the only unified online platform for companies that need to manage payroll, benefits, and government compliance. We’ve solved massive challenges, technological and otherwise, and we’re continuing to build a world-class team to extend our lead.

JOB DESCRIPTION

Justworks needs an exceptional Front-End Engineer to build new features and functionality. In this role, you will own significant portions of our front-end code base.

You will need a commitment to team work, hustle, and strong communication skills. Creating a reliable, scalable, and high performance service requires exceptional technical expertise, a sound understanding of computer science fundamentals, how the Web works, and practical experience building web based applications on large-scale distributed systems. You should be somebody who enjoys working on complex system software, is focused on customer needs, and feels strongly about building good software as well as making that software achieve its operational goals.

The ideal candidate will:

  • be clearly passionate about start-up opportunities
  • have a demonstrable track record of success delivering new features or products in cloud-based architectures.
  • care both about the quality of their code and delight end-users with top-notch user experience.
  • mentor more junior team members
  • have thrived and succeeded in delivering high quality technology products/services in a hyper-growth environment where priorities shift fast

QUALIFICATIONS

  • Experience with jQuery but can comfortably write plain Object Oriented Javascript without it
  • Experience with a front-end JS framework besides jQuery (like Backbone, Ember, Angular etc.), and opinions about what makes it good or bad
  • Have a basic understanding of interaction design and UI patterns
  • Comfortable translating a visual design into a coded grid system using existing patterns or creating new ones
  • Understand how DOM rendering works and how to structure code to increase performance
  • Understand front-end security concerns such as CSS
  • Experience with CSS preprocessors
  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field
  • Familiar with CS fundamentals: object-oriented design, data structures, algorithms and complexity analysis

We have a high-energy, fast-paced startup culture. We have a company full of engaging and smart people who want to take the pain and bureaucracy out of hiring and taking care of employees.

We work hard. We are helping businesses get off the ground, enabling them to focus on running their business and leaving the HR logistics to us. Our work already affects tens of thousands of people and we're just getting started. We’re data-driven and never stop inventing ways to improve.

Even though we take what we do seriously, we have a great time doing it. Regular company happy hours, casual start-up work environment, awesome company events, amazing benefits and perks are just some of the highlights of working at Justworks.

If you want to work in an entreprenurial environment, build something meaningful and have fun while doing it, we would love to hear from you.

title: Senior Web Developer
description:
About Jet.com

Jet.com is a nascent, well-funded start-up in the ecommerce space which plans to be the hottest startup of 2015 (you will be kicking yourself if you can do this job but don’t get in touch with us!). We have already recruited some of the best developers on the east coast, so you will be working with a very smart group of people in a very exciting company.

Job Description

We are looking for a number of Web Developers across all product verticals within our Engineering team, including merchant portal, consumer site, customer/merchant service systems. This role requires someone with a deep understanding of JavaScript, with all of its wonderful peculiarities, and how to best optimize web applications to achieve rich and fluid interaction. We’re looking for someone who understands the importance of abstraction and who gets excited about the latest JavaScript and CSS frameworks. This person should also be able to provide guidance to junior developers in their day-to-day development tasks and help inform decisions regarding when to roll-your-own or when to grab an off-the-shelf solution to a given problem. Moving forward we want our code to be responsive, optimized, and clean.

Skills & Requirements

You live at the intersection of stories and code. You're most comfortable with JavaScript, AngularJS, HTML and CSS, but if you have to make something in Xcode you'll make it happen or you'll figure it out. You care about everything with your name on it being pixel perfect for no other reason than it just has to.

Git experience (specifically feature branch, pull request, CI workflows) Deep JavaScript knowledge A love for all things CSS3 (all the latest and greatest techniques) HTML5 semantic architecture Understanding the separation of template and controller logic AngularJS experience Experience solving issues for high-pixel density displays Test driven development or the desire to learn it B.S./B.A. in Computer Science or equivalent experience
